entities.name: Jorge Luis Borges
mumblings: I have always imagined that Paradise will be a kind of library.
To fall in love is to create a religion that has a fallible god.
Reality is not always probable, or likely.
The original is unfaithful to the translation.
A book is not an isolated being: it is a relationship, an axis of innumerable relationships.

entities.name: James Baldwin
mumblings: You have to go the way your blood beats.
Not everything that is faced can be changed, but nothing can be changed until it is faced.
People are trapped in history and history is trapped in them.
You think your pain and your heartbreak are unprecedented in the history of the world, but then you read.
Love takes off the masks that we fear we cannot live without and know we cannot live within.

entities.name: Martin Buber
mumblings: The world is not the sum of the things, it is the sum of their relationships.
In the beginning is the relation.
Everything depends on how we look at things.
